Content:: Tõnu Saar (6 August 1944 – 12 July 2022) was an Estonian actor.[1][2] In 1972, he graduated from the Tallinn State Conservatory's Performing Arts Department. From 1963 until 1968, he worked as a photographer. From 1972 until 1980, he worked at Estonian Youth Theatre, and from 1980 until 1998, at Estonian Drama Theatre. Besides theatre roles he appeared in a number of films and on television.[1] This article about an Estonian actor is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it.
